screen_desc: The screenshot displays the settings menu of a smartphone. The top section includes a search bar for settings and an option to add another email account. Below, there are various categories such as "Network & internet" for managing Wi-Fi and data, "Connected devices" for Bluetooth settings, and "Apps & notifications" for app preferences. The battery status is also shown at the bottom.
action_think: The user wants to change the keyboard appearance, which is usually done through the 'Language & Input' section in the settings. However, this section is not directly visible in the current screenshot. To proceed, I will first search for the relevant settings by using the search bar at the top of the screen to find 'Keyboard' or 'Language & Input'.
action_plan: Click on the search bar and type 'keyboard' or 'language & input' to find the related settings.
action_desc: Click on the search bar and type 'keyboard'
action_result:
By scrolling up on the last screen, the settings menu was revealed, allowing further access to other settings. On the current screen, the "Display" option is now at the top, which may include options for customizing the keyboard's appearance, such as themes or size.

This action makes progress towards the user's request to change the keyboard looks, as it potentially leads to settings where visual changes to the keyboard can be made. However, further navigation into the "Display" or related sections will be needed to directly modify the keyboard's appearance.
prev_action_result:
By clicking on the Settings icon located at the upper left, the user has navigated to the phone's settings menu. On the current screen, the options available are related to general device settings, including email account setup, network & internet, and apps & notifications.

This action has made progress toward the user's request to change the keyboard looks, as the next logical step would be to access the "Language & input" or similar section under the settings menu.
